Ever since the new gizmos in 0.90 I've wanted to give this a try. I finally got around to it yesterday and was fully amused when I got it to work. Then I did a google search and found that sal_vager had already done this in the spacecraft exchange subforum. And that one is way more extreme!

Anyway, I think a lot of people won't get to see this cool idea down in that sub-forum and it's visually interesting enough to be posted here. (The mods may disagree. )

Edited February 8, 2015 by Starhawk
Yep, I've been thinking about doing this to a Munar lander of mine... I doubt it'll work, but oh well. It is very cool.

...doing this to a Munar lander of mine... I doubt it'll work, but oh well.

Why wouldn't it work? All it took for me was to play with the offset gizmo while the angle snap was turned off. sal_vager got his amazing results by using combinations of the offset and rotation gizmos.

Happy landings!
I have to wonder how that thing would fly in FAR. Somehow I suspect that the answer would be "not at all".
